title: Login error
body:
Hi!

I recently moved to Korea and made an account here. However I am getting the same error over and over. When I'm trying to login I get the 

"login error 
The login server did not respond"

error message. I tried to find solutions in many many threads and/or youtube videos. There's about 10+ fixes that I tried to apply but none of them worked for me. Including changing the DNS, turning off firewall, changing the IE settings, resintalling the game, repairing the client - you name it, I've done it. 

Everytime I try to log in, it's like the client doesn't even connect to the goddamn Login server to check the validity of the username/password. I can put in ANY information into the username/password and I always get the same message. 

Interestingly enough a few days ago I was playing normally and then all of a sudden something happened and I can't figure out what -__-

It would be very helpful if some1 could offer a solution :) Thanks in advance!

Awnyi

replies.body: Your network seems to be having problems establishing a connection to our authentication servers.  My recommendation for this would be to go over our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to strengthen your network and make sure you're configured to allow a connection.  Let me know if you have any issues afterwords!

Hello,

thank you very much for your response. As i mentioned above, I went trough all these "connection issues" guides and no tips there helped me. However, I restored my PC to the point where it worked, installed a fresh Korean client and played normally. Now it doesnt work again. I think I know the turning point now.

In my dorimitory I play on a wired connection. It worked fine untill I went to school where I connected to a WiFi. Once I returned back to my dorm and connected the wired connection, I'm getting the same error again. I tried to trun off my WiFi adapter to ensure that I'm 100% only on the wired connection, however it still deosn't work. At least now I know the cause of the problem. Any suggestion, knowing this information? Thanks in advance.

Awnyi

So I tried a couple more things, which all didn't work, but I'll list them anyway to save some time and provide more info and hope somebody maybe one day contacts me with a solution ^_^ 

Syncing the windows clock
Disabling firewall completely (also added the 5 exceptions)
I don't have any antivirus program
All the CMD prompt stuff (flushdns, renew, etc)
Changing stuff in my hosts file
Changing stuff in my IE9 (default browser, advanced settings [revocation suttf etc.], loging into my acc in the browser)
Restarting my laptop a thousand times
Changing wired/wireless connections, none work
Trying to find and cancel lolreplay processes
Running the hextech repair tool, which doesnt work for Korea tho (still ran it and also repatched the game)
I do not use a VPN

Hopefuly some1 will get back to me. That would be really nice. I'd appreciate that, not gonna lie here. Cheers

Awnyi
